main_topic.author: Emmanuel Turlay
main_topic.title: LMSYS Dataset Explorer ‚Äì Cluster, segment, inspect
main_topic.content:
Hey folks ‚Äì Today, we‚Äôre releasing a free dataset explorer for the LMSYS challenge.

With our tool, you can browse through individual rows and inspect their content in great detail. We generated semantic clusters, and you can filter conversations by cluster, model pairs, winner model, and so on.

The tool is free and no login is required. Be sure to let the community know what you discover.

Click this link to start exploring: [https://app.airtrain.ai/dataset/bb589c26-8f45-4f42-8ba3-07ef51b73a03/null/1/0](https://app.airtrain.ai/dataset/bb589c26-8f45-4f42-8ba3-07ef51b73a03/null/1/0)

comments.author: Cviko Dukanovic
comments.content: Amazing product. The meta clusters and clusters are greatly produced!

comments.author: Josh Bauer
comments.content:
One fun cluster I've found: plenty of variations on the "how much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood" tongue twister. Ex: "If, IF, a woodchuck could chuck wood, how much wood could a woodchuck chuck before it lost its job as a project manager?" üòÜ

Under "Riddles and Reasoning" > "Woodchuck Tongue Twister", row 4308

reply.author: Idriss Chebak
reply.content: one cool prompt i found was "Construct a rap battle, in the style of Epic Rap Battles of History, with rhyme and meter and personal attacks relevant to each character, between Pikachu and Zeus. Each participant gets 2 verses. There is no announcer and Zeus goes first." üòÑ

comments.author: Felipe Maia Polo
comments.content: Thanks for the amazing work! Is there a way to download the cluster assignments? Thanks!

reply.author: Josh Bauer
reply.content: Glad you like it! You can't export the clusters right now, but it's on our TODO list.

reply.author: Emmanuel TurlayTopic Author
reply.content: We just shipped an update that includes clusters and token counts in the exported file. Have fun!

comments.author: Valentin Werner
comments.content:
The tool looks amazing!

As you are the the CEO of the company behind the tool, did you check the licenses? I am not sure if you are allowed to publish data from the competition on your platform, given the cc-by-nc license. I know that there was the recommendation not to do such in previous conpetitions.

Maybe you can instead show us how to use your tool to create such a dashboard instead?

All the best for your company and product!

(Also quite the PR stunt to have your employees comment on your thread (Josh & Idriss) üòâ)
comments.date: Posted 2 months ago  ¬∑  38th in this Competition

reply.author: Emmanuel TurlayTopic Author
reply.content:
Hi Valentin, thanks for the compliment!

We did check the [license](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/) and it says we are allowed to share, copy, and redistribute the material in any medium or format; adapt, remix, transform, and build upon the material; as long as we attribute credit and offer it under non-commercial terms.

The Dataset Explorer is free and requires no sign-up. The Kaggle page is linked to from the description for attribution.

We certainly want to remain compliant and are offering this work to support the community. Thanks for making us double-check the license üòâ

reply.author: Valentin Werner
reply.date: Posted 2 months ago  ¬∑  38th in this Competition
